profile_positions.description: Developed the third edition of the Public Health Situation Analysis (PHSA) report. An updated technical overview of the major public health needs and threats faced by Rohingya refugees who have fled violence in Myanmar since 25 August 2017 and have settled in camps and makeshift settlements in Cox’s Bazar, Bangladesh. The analysis summarizes the then situation based on data from a variety of sources, including surveillance data collected through WHO’s Early Warning, Alert and Response System (EWARS), health facility mapping, results from assessments and surveys on the ground (including nutritional assessments, vaccination coverage estimates), as well as background secondary data review of the health profile and epidemiological risks both in the displaced population and the host community. This analysis reported to the international community on the major threats that the refugee population will face in the upcoming monsoon season and on the level of preparedness and response to these threats among partners, and the national and subnational authorities.
